required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Prevention Options for Women Evaluation Research (POWER) Cohort
clinical_study.official_title: A Cohort for Evaluation of Open-label PrEP Delivery Among Kenyan and South African Women: The POWER Cohort

collaborator.agency: Wits Reproductive Health and HIV Institute
United States Agency for International Development (USAID)

brief_summary.textblock: The POWER Cohort study is a PrEP implementation project to demonstrate Pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) delivery for young women in Cape Town and Johannesburg, South Africa and Kisumu, Kenya.

detailed_description.textblock: PrEP will be delivered to young women according to emerging national guidelines in family planning clinics (Kisumu, Kenya), youth friendly clinics (Johannesburg, South Africa), and mobile youth friendly clinics (Cape Town, South Africa). The investigators will evaluate PrEP delivery and follow cohorts of young women at each clinic location to understand PrEP uptake and use. In the Kisumu clinics, the investigators will also offer expedited partner therapy and partner HIV self-tests to women who test positive for chlamydia and/or gonorrhea. At one clinic in Johannesburg, the investigators will evaluate the use of a decision support tool to improve the decision to initiate PrEP.

primary_outcome.measure: Demonstrate PrEP delivery models for young women in different settings and geographies.
primary_outcome.description: Mixed methods assessment of how PrEP is implemented at the user, provider, health care facility, and community levels.

secondary_outcome.description: Measure the number of young women who initiate PrEP.

Adherence by young women to PrEP. Adherence will be measured by the timing of PrEP refills and self-reported PrEP use. Blood samples for detection and quantification of PrEP levels (testing in batch) will be done for those who seroconvert to HIV and a subset who remain HIV uninfected.
Assess HIV incidence during PrEP use and non-use.

other_outcome.measure: Assess cost and cost-effectiveness of PrEP when delivered in public health clinics.
other_outcome.description: Time-motion studies will be conducted to define the cost and cost effectiveness of the intervention in terms of HIV infections averted, disability-adjusted life years saved, and incremental cost-effectiveness of PrEP over routine HIV care.

other_outcome.measure: Evaluate the acceptability of delivering expedited partner therapy.
other_outcome.description: Measure the number of women who accept STI expedited partner therapy and HIV self-test kits for their partners.

other_outcome.measure: Assess the effect of a decision support tool on PrEP uptake
other_outcome.description: Using a randomized design, evaluate if a decision support tool increases PrEP uptake.

arm_group.description: Sexually active HIV-uninfected women between 16-25 years of age will be given Truvada.

intervention.description: A fixed dose of oral co-formulated tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF)/emtricitabine (FTC) will be used as PrEP.

study_pop.textblock: Sexually active HIV uninfected women ages 16-25 will be recruited from family planning clinics, youth clinics, and youth outreach programs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 16-25 (16 and 17 year olds, where permissible by national regulations and local IRB approval)
- Able and willing to provide written informed consent
- Recently sexually active (defined as having had vaginal intercourse at least once in the previous three months)
- HIV uninfected based on negative HIV rapid tests, on the date of enrollment

contact.last_name: Elizabeth Bukusi, MBChB, MMed, MPH, PhD

facility.name: Wits Reproductive Health and HIV Institute

responsible_party.investigator_title: Prof of Medicine & Global Health, Adjunct Prof of Epidemiology, SOM: Global Health

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Emtricitabine, Tenofovir Disoproxil Fumarate Drug Combination

patient_data.ipd_description: Data from the POWER Cohort Study will be available at the end of the project by contacting the Principal Investigators.
